articles.author: Amanda Cooper, Yoruk Bahceli
articles.description: The Bank of England's modest rate hike on Thursday soothed politicians' angst over runaway borrowing costs while its pledge to deliver more if needed signalled to markets that it won't let up on inflation, but there was little comfort for the pound.
articles.title: Analysis: Bank of England offers 'something for everyone', except sterling

articles.author: Nelson Acosta
articles.description: The Cuban Central Bank issued rules this week banning state and private businesses from using ATMs and limiting cash transactions between them, as it seeks to tame runaway inflation and off-the-books business amid a grave economic crisis.
articles.title: Cuba bans company access to ATMs, limits cash transactions

articles.author: Maha Dahan, Ahmed Elimam
articles.description: Saudi Arabia will extend a voluntary oil output cut of one million barrels per day for another month to include September, it said on Thursday, adding it could be extended beyond that or deepened.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia extends 1 million bpd oil cut, may deepen it in future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits rose slightly last week, while layoffs dropped to an 11-month low in July as labor market conditions remain tight.
articles.title: US weekly jobless claims rise moderately; layoffs drop to 11-month low

articles.author: Noele Illien
articles.description: Switzerland's financial capital is bracing itself for the biggest wave of job losses in over a decade following Credit Suisse's collapse earlier this year.
articles.title: Winners and losers likely as Switzerland absorbs Credit Suisse layoffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pfizer Inc (PFE.N) on Thursday said the drugmaker will make some products available only through its emergency ordering process until further notice, as part of additional steps to manage inventory at its Rocky Mount facility.
articles.title: Pfizer taking additional steps to manage inventory at Rocky Mount Plant

articles.author: Rupam Jain
articles.description: Hindu-Muslim clashes just outside the Indian capital this week have worsened religious fault lines in the region and exposed a booming business hub to threats of violence and disruption, authorities and analysts said.
articles.title: Hindu-Muslim riots expose risk at major Indian business hub

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Jacqueline Thomsen, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump appeared in a Washington courtroom on Thursday to face charges that he led a conspiracy built on lies to overturn the 2020 presidential election, culminating in an attack on the seat of American democracy.
articles.title: Trump in court to face charges of trying to overturn election defeat

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets
articles.description: When they found the bodies of Russian troops at an abandoned position, something about the corpses looked wrong.
articles.title: On Ukraine's landmine-strewn front, even the corpses can kill

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Two U.S. Navy sailors have been arrested on charges of handing over sensitive national security material to China, U.S. officials said Thursday.
articles.title: Two US Navy sailors arrested on charges of sharing secrets with China
